PS3 PROBLEM: UPDATE Nov.22.2010 - After some further research, I was able to solve the problem. 

1. Download and install mkvtoolnix - http://www.bunkus.org/videotools/mkvtoolnix/downloads.html

2. Open mkvtoolnix and add the mkv file. Click 'Extra Options' for each element of the file (video, audio, and subtitles) and change compression to 'None'. 

3. In the 'Global' tab, choose 'Enable Splitting', select 'after this file size', choose option '4483'. 

4. Click 'Start Muxing'

5. Add the newly created mkv file to mkv2vob and everything should 'Mux' properly for PS3 playback.

This worked for me, so I hope the same tactic will work for others. All the best!  (also, the quality is amazing)

when I exit my bittorrent program then launch it again, all my torrents disappear.  Anyone else experience this?  Know the fix?

OK after reading the other comments I figured there might be an issue with the DTS soundtrack. I downloaded the Popcorn MKV Audio Converter and converted the DTS track to AC3 5.1. You can select to delete the "bad" DTS track before remuxing.

 It took about 15 mins to do this on my i5 machine. Seems to work fine now on my WDTV Live box and the file size is almost 1GB smaller without the DTS track. Software link is below for anyone who needs it.
http://www.heartware.dk/AC.ZIP
